title: OPD: 2 arrested in connection with Glitz Ultra Lounge shooting
content:
Two people were arrested in connection with a shooting that killed two people at the Glitz Ultra Lounge night club Feb. 7, but neither is facing a murder charge.
Jose Jaime Brull-Lopez, 23, arrested the day after the shooting on charges of carrying a concealed weapon and tampering with physical evidence, was arrested again. He now faces charges of shooting into a structure and using a firearm to commit a felony.
Luis Gadiel Cruz Nazario, 21, faces charges of attempted murder, aggravated assault and battery with a firearm, shooting into a structure, using a firearm to commit a felony, and illegally carrying a concealed weapon.
The shooting, at a club in Orlando's tourist district, left two people dead: Joseph Villalobos, 22, and Jonathan Avila Rojas, 33. Nine other club-goers were injured.
At least two of them have retained attorneys and are looking into suing the club's management.
Nazario was arrested on unrelated heroin trafficking charges in January, records show. Orlando police officers said he and another man sold an informant 5.7 grams of heroin for $525 in September 2015.
He was released on a $5,000 bond on Jan. 19, records show.
Brull-Lopez was released on a $5,150 bond after his first arrest. He and Nazario will be booked into Orange County Jail on Thursday evening.
Orlando police recorded 54 incidents at the Glitz Ultra Lounge in the year before the shooting. One of the incidents was a shooting in the club's parking lot that injured two people.
The club could also face eviction after failing to pay $82,663 in rent.
glotan@orlandosentinel.com or 407-420-5774
